data.title: Tsarong Dasang Damdul
data.meta_description: The Treasury of Lives is a biographical encyclopedia of Tibet, Inner Asia, and the Himalaya. Most biographies are peer reviewed.
data.text:
Anon. 1938. Who’s Who in Tibet. Calcutta: Government of India Press.

Barnett, Robbie. 2000. Lhasa: Streets With Memories. New York: Columbia University Press.

Goldstein, Melvyn. 1989. A History of Modern Tibet, 1913-1959: The Demise of the Lamaist State. Berkeley: University of California Press.

Hackett, Paul G. 2012. Theos Bernard, the White Lama. New York: Columbia University Press.

Ho, Dahpon David. 2008. “The Men Who Would Not Be Amban and the One Who Would: Four Frontline Officials and Qing Tibet Policy, 1905—1911.”Modern China,vo. 34, no. 2, pp. 210–46.

Petech, Luciano. 1973. Aristocracy and Government in Tibet, 1728-1959. Rome: Istituto Italiano Per Il Medio Ed Estremo Oriente Press.

Shakya, Tsering. 1999. The Dragon in the Land of the Snows: A History of Modern Tibet Since 1947. New York: Columbia University Press.

Srid gros bod rang skyong ljongs u yon lhan khang lo rgyus rig gnas dpyad gzhi'i rgyu cha rtsom sgrig pu'u yis rtsom sgrig byas. 2009. Bod kyi lo rgyus rig gnas dpyad gzhi'i rgyu cha bdams bsgrigs: tsha rong zla bzang dgra 'dul gyi lo rgyus rags tsam. Chengdu: si khron dpe skrun tshogs pa/ si khron mi rigs dpe skrun khang. BDRC ID: W1PD96945.

Tsarong, Dundul Namgyal. 2000. In the Service of His Country: The Biography of Dasang Damdul Tsarong, Commander General of Tibet. Ithaca: Snow Lion Publications.
